items.title: Dogon Seated Couple "Barnes Foundation Master" 18th–early
items.description: Dogon Seated Couple "Barnes Foundation Master" 18th–early 19th century Dogon peoples Wood, copper and iron alloy, applied organic materials
items.studyDescription:
材质：Copper, Iron alloy, Wood。时期：18th-early 19th century。历史背景：多贡成对雕像常与血缘、社会互补关系及仪式权力相关，并体现马里地区鲜明的雕刻传统。 根植于非洲特定族群的仪式、宫廷或社区语境，早于现代博物馆展示体系。 风格语境：African Art。 地域语境：Africa。
Material: Copper, Iron alloy, Wood. Period: 18th-early 19th century. Historical background: Dogon couple sculptures are often interpreted through themes of lineage, social complementarity, and ritual authority, with strong regional sculptural identities in Mali. Rooted in specific African ritual, court, or community contexts before modern museum display. Style context: African Art. Regional context: Africa.

items.title: Power Figure ( Nkisi N'Kondi : Mangaaka
items.description: Left: Power Figure ( Nkisi N'Kondi : Mangaaka ) 19th century Kongo artist, Yombe group; Democratic Republic of the Congo, Republic of the Congo, or Cabinda, Angola, Chiloango River region Wood, paint, metal, resin, ceramic, H. 46 7/16 in. (118 cm) MMA, Lila Acheson Wallace, Drs. Daniel and Marian Malcolm, Laura G. and James J. Ross, Jeffrey B. Soref , The Robert T. Wall Family, Dr. and Mrs. Sidney G. Clyman , and Steven Kossak Gifts, 2008 (2008.30)
items.studyDescription:
材质：Wood, Resin, Paint。时期：19th century。历史背景：刚果权力雕像（nkisi nkondi）通过嵌入材料激活灵力，用于誓约、纠纷调解与护佑，兼具法律与宗教功能。 根植于非洲特定族群的仪式、宫廷或社区语境，早于现代博物馆展示体系。 风格语境：African Art。 地域语境：Africa。
Material: Wood, Resin, Paint. Period: 19th century. Historical background: Kongo power figures (nkisi nkondi) activated spiritual force through inserted materials and were used in oath-taking, conflict mediation, and protection in community legal-spiritual life. Rooted in specific African ritual, court, or community contexts before modern museum display. Style context: African Art. Regional context: Africa.

items.title: Iyoba
items.description: Pendant Mask 16th century Edo artist; Nigeria, Court of Benin Ivory, iron, copper, 9 5/8 x 4 7/8 x 2 3/8 in. (24.5 x 12.5 x 6cm) The British Museum, London (AOA 1910.5-13.1) Queen Mother Pendant Mask: Iyoba 16th century Edo artist; Nigeria, Court of Benin Ivory, iron, copper (?), H. 9 3/8 x W. 5 x D. 3 1/4 in. (23.8 x 12.7 x 8.3 cm) MMA, The Michael C. Rockefeller Memorial Collection, Gift of Nelson A. Rockefeller, 1972 (1978.412.323)
items.studyDescription:
材质：Copper, Iron, Ivory。时期：16th century。历史背景：贝宁王国的象牙母后挂饰（iyoba）关联宫廷权力与王朝记忆，也常在当代被置于殖民收藏史与全球博物馆展示史中讨论。 当下的理解方式受到博物馆收藏与陈列框架的影响。 根植于非洲特定族群的仪式、宫廷或社区语境，早于现代博物馆展示体系。 风格语境：African Art。 地域语境：Africa / Britain。
Material: Copper, Iron, Ivory. Period: 16th century. Historical background: Benin ivory pendant masks (iyoba) relate to royal court authority and memory politics, and are often discussed today within histories of colonial collecting and global museum display. Current understanding is shaped by museum collection and display frameworks. Rooted in specific African ritual, court, or community contexts before modern museum display. Style context: African Art. Regional context: Africa / Britain.

items.title: Warrior and Attendants 16th–
items.description: Plaque: Warrior and Attendants 16th–17th century Edo artist; Nigeria, Court of Benin Brass, H. 18 3/4 in. (47.6 cm) MMA, Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Klaus G. Perls, 1990 (1990.332) Court ceremony showing the King of Benin on horseback and his retinue. From Olfert Dapper, Beschreibung von Afrika (1967: pl.opp.486), first published in Amsterdam in 1670.
items.studyDescription:
材质：Not stated in source slide.。时期：16th-17th century。历史背景：贝宁王国的象牙母后挂饰（iyoba）关联宫廷权力与王朝记忆，也常在当代被置于殖民收藏史与全球博物馆展示史中讨论。 根植于非洲特定族群的仪式、宫廷或社区语境，早于现代博物馆展示体系。 风格语境：African Art。 地域语境：Africa。
Material: Not stated in source slide.. Period: 16th-17th century. Historical background: Benin ivory pendant masks (iyoba) relate to royal court authority and memory politics, and are often discussed today within histories of colonial collecting and global museum display. Rooted in specific African ritual, court, or community contexts before modern museum display. Style context: African Art. Regional context: Africa.

metadata.author: Edo artist
metadata.historicalBackground:
贝宁王国的象牙母后挂饰（iyoba）关联宫廷权力与王朝记忆，也常在当代被置于殖民收藏史与全球博物馆展示史中讨论。 根植于非洲特定族群的仪式、宫廷或社区语境，早于现代博物馆展示体系。 风格语境：African Art。 地域语境：Africa。
Benin ivory pendant masks (iyoba) relate to royal court authority and memory politics, and are often discussed today within histories of colonial collecting and global museum display. Rooted in specific African ritual, court, or community contexts before modern museum display. Style context: African Art. Regional context: Africa.

items.title: A.W.N. Pugin (portrait reference)
items.description: Reference portrait of Augustus Welby Northmore Pugin, shown as one of the key figures in Gothic Revival and design reform debates.
items.studyDescription:
材质：Engraving / print reproduction。时期：19th century (Victorian design reform context)。历史背景：该肖像用于介绍普金在设计改革中的理论地位：他强调哥特建筑的结构真实性、功能逻辑与宗教伦理的一致性，对后续维多利亚时代设计话语影响深远。
Material: Engraving / print reproduction. Period: 19th century (Victorian design reform context). Historical background: This portrait is used to introduce Pugin's theoretical role in design reform: he argued for coherence among Gothic structure, function, and religious ethics, strongly shaping later Victorian design discourse.

metadata.author: Britain artist
metadata.historicalBackground:
该肖像用于介绍普金在设计改革中的理论地位：他强调哥特建筑的结构真实性、功能逻辑与宗教伦理的一致性，对后续维多利亚时代设计话语影响深远。
This portrait is used to introduce Pugin's theoretical role in design reform: he argued for coherence among Gothic structure, function, and religious ethics, strongly shaping later Victorian design discourse.

items.title: Owen Jones (portrait reference)
items.description: Reference portrait of Owen Jones, an important nineteenth-century architect-designer and ornament theorist.
items.studyDescription:
材质：Engraving / print reproduction。时期：19th century (Victorian design theory context)。历史背景：该肖像用于说明欧文·琼斯在19世纪装饰理论中的核心作用；其《装饰语法》把历史装饰与色彩原则系统化，深刻影响设计教育与工业装饰实践。
Material: Engraving / print reproduction. Period: 19th century (Victorian design theory context). Historical background: This portrait frames Owen Jones's central role in nineteenth-century ornament theory; The Grammar of Ornament systematized historical motifs and color principles, influencing design education and industrial decoration.

metadata.author: Britain artist
metadata.historicalBackground:
该肖像用于说明欧文·琼斯在19世纪装饰理论中的核心作用；其《装饰语法》把历史装饰与色彩原则系统化，深刻影响设计教育与工业装饰实践。
This portrait frames Owen Jones's central role in nineteenth-century ornament theory; The Grammar of Ornament systematized historical motifs and color principles, influencing design education and industrial decoration.

items.title: Henry Cole (portrait reference)
items.description: Reference portrait of Sir Henry Cole, a leading organizer of the Great Exhibition and design-reform institutions.
items.studyDescription:
材质：Engraving / print reproduction。时期：19th century (Victorian design reform context)。历史背景：该肖像对应亨利·科尔在1851年大博览会及南肯辛顿体系中的制度性作用：通过展览、博物馆与教育联动，推动“良好设计”进入公众消费与工业生产。
Material: Engraving / print reproduction. Period: 19th century (Victorian design reform context). Historical background: This portrait corresponds to Henry Cole's institutional role in the 1851 Exhibition and the South Kensington system, linking exhibitions, museums, and education to move 'good design' into public consumption and industry.

metadata.author: Britain artist
metadata.historicalBackground:
该肖像对应亨利·科尔在1851年大博览会及南肯辛顿体系中的制度性作用：通过展览、博物馆与教育联动，推动“良好设计”进入公众消费与工业生产。
This portrait corresponds to Henry Cole's institutional role in the 1851 Exhibition and the South Kensington system, linking exhibitions, museums, and education to move 'good design' into public consumption and industry.

metadata.historicalBackgroundEn: This portrait corresponds to Henry Cole's institutional role in the 1851 Exhibition and the South Kensington system, linking exhibitions, museums, and education to move 'good design' into public consumption and industry.

items.title: Christopher Dresser (portrait reference)
items.description: Reference portrait of Christopher Dresser, frequently described as a pioneering professional designer for industrial production.
items.studyDescription:
材质：Photographic / print portrait reproduction。时期：19th century (Design Reform and Aesthetic Movement context)。历史背景：该肖像用于引入德雷瑟的跨媒介设计实践：他把植物学研究、几何抽象与工业可制造性结合，推动了现代职业设计师角色的形成。
Material: Photographic / print portrait reproduction. Period: 19th century (Design Reform and Aesthetic Movement context). Historical background: This portrait introduces Dresser's cross-media design practice: he combined botanical study, geometric abstraction, and manufacturability, helping define the modern professional designer.

items.title: Queen Victoria and Prince Albert (reference photograph)
items.description: Reference royal photograph used to frame the political and court context around the Great Exhibition era.
items.studyDescription:
材质：Photographic print reproduction。时期：Mid-19th century (Victorian court context)。历史背景：该图用于补充维多利亚王室语境。阿尔伯特亲王与王室赞助对1851年博览会及其“国家文明展示”叙事具有关键意义。
Material: Photographic print reproduction. Period: Mid-19th century (Victorian court context). Historical background: This image provides royal context: Prince Albert and court patronage were central to the 1851 Exhibition and its narrative of national civilizational display.

metadata.author: Britain artist
metadata.historicalBackground:
该图用于补充维多利亚王室语境。阿尔伯特亲王与王室赞助对1851年博览会及其“国家文明展示”叙事具有关键意义。
This image provides royal context: Prince Albert and court patronage were central to the 1851 Exhibition and its narrative of national civilizational display.

items.title: William Morris (portrait reference)
items.description: Reference portrait of William Morris, frequently used in teaching Arts and Crafts critiques of industrial modernity.
items.studyDescription:
材质：Photographic portrait reproduction。时期：Late 19th century (Arts and Crafts context)。历史背景：该肖像常用于说明莫里斯对机械化生产美学的批评，以及工艺美术运动关于劳动尊严、材料诚实性与社会改革的主张。
Material: Photographic portrait reproduction. Period: Late 19th century (Arts and Crafts context). Historical background: This portrait is often used to discuss Morris's critique of mechanized production and Arts and Crafts claims about dignified labor, material honesty, and social reform.

metadata.author: Frederick Hollyer
metadata.historicalBackground:
该肖像常用于说明莫里斯对机械化生产美学的批评，以及工艺美术运动关于劳动尊严、材料诚实性与社会改革的主张。
This portrait is often used to discuss Morris's critique of mechanized production and Arts and Crafts claims about dignified labor, material honesty, and social reform.

metadata.historicalBackgroundEn: This portrait is often used to discuss Morris's critique of mechanized production and Arts and Crafts claims about dignified labor, material honesty, and social reform.

items.title: The British Workman (masthead reference)
items.description: Reference masthead from The British Workman, used for Victorian labor education and moral-reform print culture context.
items.studyDescription:
材质：Printed masthead reproduction。时期：Mid to late 19th century (Victorian periodical culture)。历史背景：该刊头图像反映维多利亚时期面向工人阶层的宗教与道德改良出版实践，体现大众印刷媒介如何参与社会纪律与价值传播。
Material: Printed masthead reproduction. Period: Mid to late 19th century (Victorian periodical culture). Historical background: This masthead reflects Victorian religious and moral reform publishing for working-class readers, showing how mass print participated in social discipline and value transmission.

metadata.period: Mid to late 19th century (Victorian periodical culture)

items.title: Oscar Wilde, photographed by Napoleon Sarony (reference)
items.description: Reference portrait of Oscar Wilde associated with the transatlantic public image of Aestheticism.
items.studyDescription:
材质：Albumen silver print (photograph)。时期：Late 19th century (Aesthetic Movement context)。历史背景：该肖像反映审美主义在跨大西洋媒体中的形象传播：王尔德的服饰、姿态与摄影陈设共同构成了19世纪末“审美人格”的可复制视觉模板。
Material: Albumen silver print (photograph). Period: Late 19th century (Aesthetic Movement context). Historical background: This portrait reflects transatlantic media circulation of Aestheticism: Wilde's styling, pose, and studio staging formed a reproducible late-nineteenth-century visual template of the 'aesthetic personality.'

metadata.author: Napoleon Sarony
metadata.historicalBackground:
该肖像反映审美主义在跨大西洋媒体中的形象传播：王尔德的服饰、姿态与摄影陈设共同构成了19世纪末“审美人格”的可复制视觉模板。
This portrait reflects transatlantic media circulation of Aestheticism: Wilde's styling, pose, and studio staging formed a reproducible late-nineteenth-century visual template of the 'aesthetic personality.'
metadata.historicalBackgroundZh: 该肖像反映审美主义在跨大西洋媒体中的形象传播：王尔德的服饰、姿态与摄影陈设共同构成了19世纪末“审美人格”的可复制视觉模板。
metadata.historicalBackgroundEn: This portrait reflects transatlantic media circulation of Aestheticism: Wilde's styling, pose, and studio staging formed a reproducible late-nineteenth-century visual template of the 'aesthetic personality.'

items.title: Crystal Palace, Hyde Park (reference exterior view)
items.description: Reference exterior engraving of the Crystal Palace in Hyde Park for the Great Exhibition of 1851.
items.studyDescription:
材质：Engraving / print reproduction。时期：Mid-19th century (Great Exhibition context)。历史背景：该图用于说明水晶宫作为预制铁玻建筑的范式意义：它将工程效率、帝国展陈与公众消费空间整合为同一视觉事件。
Material: Engraving / print reproduction. Period: Mid-19th century (Great Exhibition context). Historical background: This view highlights the Crystal Palace as a model of prefabricated iron-and-glass architecture, integrating engineering efficiency, imperial display, and mass public consumption in one visual event.

metadata.author: Britain artist
metadata.historicalBackground:
该图用于说明水晶宫作为预制铁玻建筑的范式意义：它将工程效率、帝国展陈与公众消费空间整合为同一视觉事件。
This view highlights the Crystal Palace as a model of prefabricated iron-and-glass architecture, integrating engineering efficiency, imperial display, and mass public consumption in one visual event.
metadata.historicalBackgroundZh: 该图用于说明水晶宫作为预制铁玻建筑的范式意义：它将工程效率、帝国展陈与公众消费空间整合为同一视觉事件。
metadata.historicalBackgroundEn: This view highlights the Crystal Palace as a model of prefabricated iron-and-glass architecture, integrating engineering efficiency, imperial display, and mass public consumption in one visual event.

items.title: John Ruskin as a young man (reference portrait)
items.description: Reference portrait of young John Ruskin, used to introduce his role in Victorian art criticism and design ethics.
items.studyDescription:
材质：Watercolor / print reproduction。时期：Mid-19th century (Victorian criticism context)。历史背景：该肖像用于引入拉斯金早期思想语境：其对哥特、劳动与“诚实装饰”的论述深刻影响了工艺美术与设计改革中的伦理维度。
Material: Watercolor / print reproduction. Period: Mid-19th century (Victorian criticism context). Historical background: This portrait introduces Ruskin's early intellectual context; his writings on Gothic form, labor, and 'truthful' ornament strongly shaped the ethical dimension of Arts and Crafts and design reform.

metadata.author: Britain artist
metadata.historicalBackground:
该肖像用于引入拉斯金早期思想语境：其对哥特、劳动与“诚实装饰”的论述深刻影响了工艺美术与设计改革中的伦理维度。
This portrait introduces Ruskin's early intellectual context; his writings on Gothic form, labor, and 'truthful' ornament strongly shaped the ethical dimension of Arts and Crafts and design reform.
metadata.historicalBackgroundZh: 该肖像用于引入拉斯金早期思想语境：其对哥特、劳动与“诚实装饰”的论述深刻影响了工艺美术与设计改革中的伦理维度。
metadata.historicalBackgroundEn: This portrait introduces Ruskin's early intellectual context; his writings on Gothic form, labor, and 'truthful' ornament strongly shaped the ethical dimension of Arts and Crafts and design reform.

items.title: Joseph Paxton (engraved portrait reference)
items.description: Reference engraved portrait of Joseph Paxton, designer of the Crystal Palace.
items.studyDescription:
材质：Engraving。时期：Mid-19th century (Great Exhibition context)。历史背景：该版画强调帕克斯顿的工程与园艺背景如何转化为1851年展馆设计实践，体现维多利亚时期工程师形象的公共传播机制。
Material: Engraving. Period: Mid-19th century (Great Exhibition context). Historical background: This engraving emphasizes how Paxton's engineering and horticultural background informed the 1851 exhibition building, reflecting Victorian public circulation of engineer-innovator identities.

metadata.author: S. W. Reynolds (engraver), after O. Oakley
metadata.historicalBackground:
该版画强调帕克斯顿的工程与园艺背景如何转化为1851年展馆设计实践，体现维多利亚时期工程师形象的公共传播机制。
This engraving emphasizes how Paxton's engineering and horticultural background informed the 1851 exhibition building, reflecting Victorian public circulation of engineer-innovator identities.

metadata.historicalBackgroundEn: This engraving emphasizes how Paxton's engineering and horticultural background informed the 1851 exhibition building, reflecting Victorian public circulation of engineer-innovator identities.

items.title: Imperial Federation: Map of the World (The Graphic supplement)
items.description: Pictorial imperial map associated with Walter Crane and published as an 1886 supplement to The Graphic.
items.studyDescription:
材质：Colour lithograph。时期：Late 19th century (high imperial visual culture)。历史背景：该地图把帝国版图、航运路线与统计信息整合为单幅图像，是维多利亚晚期通过视觉媒介建构帝国共同体想象的重要案例。
Material: Colour lithograph. Period: Late 19th century (high imperial visual culture). Historical background: This map integrates imperial territory, shipping routes, and statistics into a single image, making it a key late-Victorian case of constructing imperial community through visual media.

metadata.author: Walter Crane (with J. C. R. Colomb, statistics)
metadata.historicalBackground:
该地图把帝国版图、航运路线与统计信息整合为单幅图像，是维多利亚晚期通过视觉媒介建构帝国共同体想象的重要案例。
This map integrates imperial territory, shipping routes, and statistics into a single image, making it a key late-Victorian case of constructing imperial community through visual media.

items.title: Modern credit-card image (teaching joke reference)
items.description: Contemporary credit-card image used in class as a humorous contrast, not a core nineteenth-century artwork.
items.studyDescription:
材质：Digital image。时期：Late 20th to early 21st century (contemporary reference)。历史背景：该图为课堂对照用的现代图像，不属于19世纪设计改革案例本体，主要用于轻松提示“credit”一词的双关。
Material: Digital image. Period: Late 20th to early 21st century (contemporary reference). Historical background: This is a modern classroom comparison image rather than a nineteenth-century reform case, mainly used as a playful pun on the word 'credit.'

metadata.author: Global artist
metadata.historicalBackground:
该图为课堂对照用的现代图像，不属于19世纪设计改革案例本体，主要用于轻松提示“credit”一词的双关。

items.title: Crystal Palace, Hyde Park (exterior view)
items.description: Exterior view of the Crystal Palace built for the Great Exhibition in Hyde Park, London.
items.studyDescription:
材质：Engraving / print reproduction。时期：Mid-19th century (Great Exhibition architecture)。历史背景：该外景图显示水晶宫以标准化构件实现大跨度与快速建造，成为工业时代展览建筑与公众奇观经济结合的标志性形态。
Material: Engraving / print reproduction. Period: Mid-19th century (Great Exhibition architecture). Historical background: This exterior view shows how standardized components enabled rapid construction and large spans, making the Crystal Palace emblematic of industrial-age exhibition architecture and spectacle economy.

metadata.author: Britain artist
metadata.historicalBackground:
该外景图显示水晶宫以标准化构件实现大跨度与快速建造，成为工业时代展览建筑与公众奇观经济结合的标志性形态。
This exterior view shows how standardized components enabled rapid construction and large spans, making the Crystal Palace emblematic of industrial-age exhibition architecture and spectacle economy.
metadata.historicalBackgroundZh: 该外景图显示水晶宫以标准化构件实现大跨度与快速建造，成为工业时代展览建筑与公众奇观经济结合的标志性形态。
metadata.historicalBackgroundEn: This exterior view shows how standardized components enabled rapid construction and large spans, making the Crystal Palace emblematic of industrial-age exhibition architecture and spectacle economy.

items.title: Great Exhibition interior view (Dickinson's Comprehensive Pictures)
items.description: Interior view linked to Dickinson Brothers' visual documentation of the Great Exhibition.
items.studyDescription:
材质：Color lithograph。时期：Mid-19th century (Great Exhibition print culture)。历史背景：该室内图像体现了博览会如何通过图像出版扩大影响：展陈秩序、商品密度与观众行为被编码为可流通的视觉知识。
Material: Color lithograph. Period: Mid-19th century (Great Exhibition print culture). Historical background: This interior image shows how exhibition publishing expanded the event's reach: display order, commodity density, and visitor behavior were encoded as portable visual knowledge.

metadata.author: Dickinson Brothers (publishers)
metadata.historicalBackground:
该室内图像体现了博览会如何通过图像出版扩大影响：展陈秩序、商品密度与观众行为被编码为可流通的视觉知识。
This interior image shows how exhibition publishing expanded the event's reach: display order, commodity density, and visitor behavior were encoded as portable visual knowledge.
metadata.historicalBackgroundZh: 该室内图像体现了博览会如何通过图像出版扩大影响：展陈秩序、商品密度与观众行为被编码为可流通的视觉知识。
metadata.historicalBackgroundEn: This interior image shows how exhibition publishing expanded the event's reach: display order, commodity density, and visitor behavior were encoded as portable visual knowledge.

items.title: Floral furnishing chintz (False Principles example)
items.description: Printed furnishing chintz with naturalistic floral motifs, discussed in Henry Cole's design-reform critique of 'false principles.'
items.studyDescription:
材质：Printed cotton textile (chintz)。时期：Mid-19th century (Design Reform critique context)。历史背景：该印花棉布常在“False Principles”语境中被作为反例：其写实花卉与缎带错视效果被批评为偏离结构与用途的装饰“真实”。
Material: Printed cotton textile (chintz). Period: Mid-19th century (Design Reform critique context). Historical background: In 'False Principles' discourse, this chintz was treated as a negative example: its naturalistic flowers and illusionistic ribbon effects were criticized as ornament detached from structure and use.

metadata.author: Britain artist
metadata.historicalBackground:
该印花棉布常在“False Principles”语境中被作为反例：其写实花卉与缎带错视效果被批评为偏离结构与用途的装饰“真实”。
In 'False Principles' discourse, this chintz was treated as a negative example: its naturalistic flowers and illusionistic ribbon effects were criticized as ornament detached from structure and use.
metadata.historicalBackgroundZh: 该印花棉布常在“False Principles”语境中被作为反例：其写实花卉与缎带错视效果被批评为偏离结构与用途的装饰“真实”。
metadata.historicalBackgroundEn: In 'False Principles' discourse, this chintz was treated as a negative example: its naturalistic flowers and illusionistic ribbon effects were criticized as ornament detached from structure and use.

items.title: R. W. Winfield, gas jet lamp in the form of a convolvulus
items.description: Gas jet lamp attributed to R. W. Winfield of Birmingham, cited in slide text as an 1848 example criticized in design-reform debates.
items.studyDescription:
材质：Metal (gilt metal / gas-light fitting)。时期：Mid-19th century (Design Reform critique context)。历史背景：该器物在课程中作为科尔“False Principles”批评案例，反映维多利亚中期关于自然模仿装饰、工业复制与“良好品味”标准的争论。
Material: Metal (gilt metal / gas-light fitting). Period: Mid-19th century (Design Reform critique context). Historical background: In class this object functions as a 'False Principles' case from Cole's critique, reflecting mid-Victorian debates over naturalistic imitation, industrial reproduction, and standards of good taste.

metadata.author: R. W. Winfield
metadata.historicalBackground:
该器物在课程中作为科尔“False Principles”批评案例，反映维多利亚中期关于自然模仿装饰、工业复制与“良好品味”标准的争论。
In class this object functions as a 'False Principles' case from Cole's critique, reflecting mid-Victorian debates over naturalistic imitation, industrial reproduction, and standards of good taste.
metadata.historicalBackgroundZh: 该器物在课程中作为科尔“False Principles”批评案例，反映维多利亚中期关于自然模仿装饰、工业复制与“良好品味”标准的争论。
metadata.historicalBackgroundEn: In class this object functions as a 'False Principles' case from Cole's critique, reflecting mid-Victorian debates over naturalistic imitation, industrial reproduction, and standards of good taste.

items.title: Heywood, Higginbottom and Smith wallpaper with Crystal Palace and Serpentine
items.description: Machine-printed wallpaper depicting the Crystal Palace and Serpentine landscape, presented in design-reform teaching context.
items.studyDescription:
材质：Machine-printed wallpaper on paper。时期：Mid-19th century (Design Reform and Great Exhibition context)。历史背景：该壁纸将展览建筑景观转化为可家居消费的图像商品，体现了博览会视觉文化向日常室内空间扩散的机制，也成为设计改革批评的对象。
Material: Machine-printed wallpaper on paper. Period: Mid-19th century (Design Reform and Great Exhibition context). Historical background: This wallpaper turned exhibition architecture into domestic visual commodity, showing how Great Exhibition imagery moved into interiors and became a target of design-reform criticism.

metadata.period: Mid-19th century (Design Reform and Great Exhibition context)
metadata.author: Heywood, Higginbottom and Smith
metadata.historicalBackground:
该壁纸将展览建筑景观转化为可家居消费的图像商品，体现了博览会视觉文化向日常室内空间扩散的机制，也成为设计改革批评的对象。
This wallpaper turned exhibition architecture into domestic visual commodity, showing how Great Exhibition imagery moved into interiors and became a target of design-reform criticism.

metadata.historicalBackgroundEn: This wallpaper turned exhibition architecture into domestic visual commodity, showing how Great Exhibition imagery moved into interiors and became a target of design-reform criticism.

tags: Mid-19th century (Design Reform and Great Exhibition context)

items.title: R. W. Winfield, gas jet lamp in the form of a convolvulus (repeat detail)
items.description: Repeat image of the Winfield convolvulus gas lamp, reused on the slide that quotes Henry Cole's critique of imitative ornament.
items.studyDescription:
材质：Metal (gilt metal / gas-light fitting)。时期：Mid-19th century (Design Reform critique context)。历史背景：该图为同一灯具在后续批评页中的重复呈现，用于强调科尔对“自然摹仿式装饰”及其视觉夸张性的反对。
Material: Metal (gilt metal / gas-light fitting). Period: Mid-19th century (Design Reform critique context). Historical background: This is a repeated image of the same lamp on the following critique slide, used to emphasize Cole's opposition to natural-imitation ornament and visual excess.

metadata.author: R. W. Winfield
metadata.historicalBackground:
该图为同一灯具在后续批评页中的重复呈现，用于强调科尔对“自然摹仿式装饰”及其视觉夸张性的反对。
This is a repeated image of the same lamp on the following critique slide, used to emphasize Cole's opposition to natural-imitation ornament and visual excess.
metadata.historicalBackgroundZh: 该图为同一灯具在后续批评页中的重复呈现，用于强调科尔对“自然摹仿式装饰”及其视觉夸张性的反对。
metadata.historicalBackgroundEn: This is a repeated image of the same lamp on the following critique slide, used to emphasize Cole's opposition to natural-imitation ornament and visual excess.

items.title: Felix Summerly tea service (Henry Cole design, Minton manufacture)
items.description: Part of the Felix Summerly tea service designed by Henry Cole and manufactured by Minton for reform-minded domestic consumption.
items.studyDescription:
材质：Earthenware。时期：Mid-19th century (Design Reform domestic ware context)。历史背景：该茶具体现“以可负担日用品推广良好设计”的改革路径：通过标准化生产与简化造型，把审美教育嵌入中产家庭日常器用。
Material: Earthenware. Period: Mid-19th century (Design Reform domestic ware context). Historical background: This tea set exemplifies reform through affordable domestic goods: standardized production and simplified form embedded aesthetic education into everyday middle-class use.

metadata.period: Mid-19th century (Design Reform domestic ware context)
metadata.author: Henry Cole (design) and Minton & Co. (manufacture)
metadata.historicalBackground:
该茶具体现“以可负担日用品推广良好设计”的改革路径：通过标准化生产与简化造型，把审美教育嵌入中产家庭日常器用。
This tea set exemplifies reform through affordable domestic goods: standardized production and simplified form embedded aesthetic education into everyday middle-class use.
metadata.historicalBackgroundZh: 该茶具体现“以可负担日用品推广良好设计”的改革路径：通过标准化生产与简化造型，把审美教育嵌入中产家庭日常器用。
metadata.historicalBackgroundEn: This tea set exemplifies reform through affordable domestic goods: standardized production and simplified form embedded aesthetic education into everyday middle-class use.

tags: Mid-19th century (Design Reform domestic ware context)

items.title: “Minster” jug (Henry Cole / Felix Summerly context)
items.description: Relief-decorated 'Minster' jug shown on the comparison side of the slide and associated with Henry Cole's design-reform domestic ware program.
items.studyDescription:
材质：Earthenware / parian-type ceramic。时期：Mid-19th century (Design Reform domestic ware context)。历史背景：该壶在课程中作为对比对象，显示设计改革并非单一风格，而是在宗教历史风格、工业可制造性与家庭消费之间持续调和。
Material: Earthenware / parian-type ceramic. Period: Mid-19th century (Design Reform domestic ware context). Historical background: Used in class as a comparison object, this jug shows that design reform was not a single style but an ongoing negotiation between historicist language, manufacturability, and domestic consumption.

metadata.period: Mid-19th century (Design Reform domestic ware context)
metadata.author: Stoke-on-Trent artist
metadata.historicalBackground:
该壶在课程中作为对比对象，显示设计改革并非单一风格，而是在宗教历史风格、工业可制造性与家庭消费之间持续调和。
Used in class as a comparison object, this jug shows that design reform was not a single style but an ongoing negotiation between historicist language, manufacturability, and domestic consumption.
metadata.historicalBackgroundZh: 该壶在课程中作为对比对象，显示设计改革并非单一风格，而是在宗教历史风格、工业可制造性与家庭消费之间持续调和。
metadata.historicalBackgroundEn: Used in class as a comparison object, this jug shows that design reform was not a single style but an ongoing negotiation between historicist language, manufacturability, and domestic consumption.

tags: Mid-19th century (Design Reform domestic ware context)

items.title: The Medieval Court, Great Exhibition (Louis Haghe view)
items.description: Lithographic view of the Medieval Court at the Great Exhibition, associated with Louis Haghe and Dickinson publication.
items.studyDescription:
材质：Color lithograph。时期：Mid-19th century (Great Exhibition medieval display context)。历史背景：该图展示中世纪展区如何把宗教器物、金工与装饰工艺编排为可观赏的历史场景，体现博览会以“风格化历史”组织现代消费视觉的机制。
Material: Color lithograph. Period: Mid-19th century (Great Exhibition medieval display context). Historical background: This view shows how the Medieval Court staged ecclesiastical objects, metalwork, and ornament as a consumable historical scene, demonstrating how the Exhibition organized modern visual consumption through stylized history.

items.title: The Great Stove (A.W.N. Pugin; Hardman and Minton)
items.description: The Great Stove shown as a Gothic Revival centerpiece linked to Pugin, John Hardman & Co., and Minton tiles.
items.studyDescription:
材质：Ironwork with ceramic tile decoration。时期：Mid-19th century (Great Exhibition medieval display context)。历史背景：该炉具体现1851年展陈中“工业制造 + 历史风格”混合策略：通过哥特构件与彩釉面板，把中世纪权威转译为现代国家设计品味。
Material: Ironwork with ceramic tile decoration. Period: Mid-19th century (Great Exhibition medieval display context). Historical background: This stove exemplifies the 1851 strategy of combining industrial manufacture with historicist style: Gothic structure and polychrome panels translated medieval authority into modern national design taste.

metadata.period: Mid-19th century (Great Exhibition medieval display context)
metadata.author: A.W.N. Pugin; John Hardman & Co.; Minton

This stove exemplifies the 1851 strategy of combining industrial manufacture with historicist style: Gothic structure and polychrome panels translated medieval authority into modern national design taste.

items.title: Jardiniere from the Medieval Court (attributed to A.W.N. Pugin)
items.description: Small medievalizing jardiniere associated with the Great Exhibition Medieval Court and attributed in scholarship to Pugin's design context.
items.studyDescription:
材质：Gilt metal frame with decorated ceramic panels。时期：Mid-19th century (Great Exhibition medieval display context)。历史背景：该器物被用于中世纪展区语境，展示哥特语汇在小型陈设物中的工业化转译方式：金属框架与彩饰面板共同强化“历史风格可复制化”的设计逻辑。
Material: Gilt metal frame with decorated ceramic panels. Period: Mid-19th century (Great Exhibition medieval display context). Historical background: Shown in Medieval Court context, this object demonstrates industrial translation of Gothic language into small decorative furnishings: metal framing and colored panels reinforce the logic of reproducible historicist style.

items.title: Frontispiece to The True Principles of Pointed or Christian Architecture
items.description: Frontispiece image from A.W.N. Pugin's architectural treatise on pointed (Gothic) architecture.
items.studyDescription:
材质：Printed book frontispiece。时期：Early to mid-19th century (Gothic Revival theory context)。历史背景：该扉页把“建筑、信仰、工艺伦理”整合为普金理论的视觉入口，成为设计改革课程中理解哥特复兴思想体系的关键文献图像。
Material: Printed book frontispiece. Period: Early to mid-19th century (Gothic Revival theory context). Historical background: This frontispiece serves as a visual gateway to Pugin's integration of architecture, faith, and craft ethics, making it a key documentary image for understanding Gothic Revival theory in design reform.

metadata.period: Early to mid-19th century (Gothic Revival theory context)
metadata.author: A.W.N. Pugin
metadata.historicalBackground:

This frontispiece serves as a visual gateway to Pugin's integration of architecture, faith, and craft ethics, making it a key documentary image for understanding Gothic Revival theory in design reform.

items.title: A.W.N. Pugin portrait with quotation context (reference)
items.description: Reference portrait of A.W.N. Pugin used alongside the quote slide to emphasize his moral and pedagogical claims for architecture.
items.studyDescription:
材质：Oil portrait reproduction。时期：Mid-19th century (Gothic Revival context)。历史背景：该肖像配合引文使用，强调普金将建筑视为社会道德教育媒介的立场；在课程中用于连接理论文本与人物形象传播。
Material: Oil portrait reproduction. Period: Mid-19th century (Gothic Revival context). Historical background: Used with the quote slide, this portrait stresses Pugin's claim that architecture functions as a medium of moral education; in class it links theoretical text with image-based persona building.

metadata.author: Britain artist

items.title: A.W.N. Pugin, Wallpaper Design
items.description: The above is not required; it is for comparison only L: A.W.N. Pugin, Wallpaper Design, c. 1851. For Palace of Westminster. Pencil and wash on paper. R: Wallpaper patterned with perspective representations of architecture, c1853. Color print from wood blocks, on paper. Part of Henry Cole’s “False Principles” Exhibition.
items.studyDescription:
材质：Wood, Paper。时期：19th century (c. 1851)。历史背景：与1851年大博览会密切相关；亨利·科尔等改革者通过博物馆展示与批评机制，推动工业时代的设计标准与公共审美改良。 与A.W.N.普金的哥特复兴理论相关，他将中世纪建筑与装饰视为对工业时代折衷审美的道德性替代方案。 风格语境：Industrial Design。 地域语境：France / Britain。
Material: Wood, Paper. Period: 19th century (c. 1851). Historical background: Closely tied to the Great Exhibition (1851), where reformers such as Henry Cole used museum display and criticism to improve public taste and design standards under industrial production. Linked to A.W.N. Pugin's Gothic Revival theory, which framed medieval architecture and ornament as morally grounded alternatives to eclectic industrial-era taste. Style context: Industrial Design. Regional context: France / Britain.

items.title: Cooking Culture: Situating Food and Drink in the Nineteenth Century Thomas Onwyn Cartoon
items.description: c.1877 Dining is the privilege of civilization – a way that cultures and groups consolidate themselves – consider ‘fusion cuisine’ The 1887 edition of Eliza Acton’s Modern Cookery for Private Families features recipes for Mauritian shrimp chutney, Jewish smoked beef, French salad, and Portuguese rice pudding, among other delicacies, and recommends that sauces be seasoned with soy, claret, coconut, etc. The expansion of ‘commodity culture’ visible at the Great Exhibition, led to fundamental changes in the ways those inside of Britain saw their relationship to the world at large. From Suzanne Daly and Ross G. Forman Introduction: Cooking Culture: Situating Food and Drink in the Nineteenth Century Thomas Onwyn Cartoon 1851

与1851年大博览会密切相关；亨利·科尔等改革者通过博物馆展示与批评机制，推动工业时代的设计标准与公共审美改良。 风格语境：Industrial Design。 地域语境：France / Britain。
Closely tied to the Great Exhibition (1851), where reformers such as Henry Cole used museum display and criticism to improve public taste and design standards under industrial production. Style context: Industrial Design. Regional context: France / Britain.

items.title: Det. Fourdinois sideboard
items.description: Det. Fourdinois sideboard
items.studyDescription:
材质：Not stated in source slide.。时期：Mid-19th century。历史背景：该侧柜与1851年伦敦大博览会语境相关，体现法国高端木作与国际博览会中“工业与工艺”展示机制的结合。
Material: Not stated in source slide.. Period: Mid-19th century. Historical background: This sideboard is tied to the 1851 Great Exhibition in London and reflects how elite French cabinetmaking was positioned within international exhibition systems that staged industry alongside craft prestige.

items.title: William Kilburn
items.description: William Kilburn (1745-1818), seaweed print used for fabric, watercolor In the Encyclopedia of Gardening published in 1828, the author draws a comparison between the skill in raising delicate flower and producing the complex designs for muslins, ‘…their attention to raising flowers contributed to improve their genius for invention in elegant fancy muslins’…

items.title: “It is not that men are ill fed, but that they have no pleasure in the work by which they make their bread and therefore
items.description: “It is not that men are ill fed, but that they have no pleasure in the work by which they make their bread and therefore look to wealth as the only means of pleasure. It is not that men are pained by the scorn of the upper classes, but they cannot endure their own, for they feel that the kind of labour to which they are condemned is verily a degrading one, and makes them less than men.” John Ruskin
items.studyDescription:
材质：Not stated in source slide.。时期：N/A (reference)。历史背景：关联工艺美术运动对工业化的批判，强调手工技艺、材料诚实性与具有社会意义的设计，以回应工厂化标准生产。 风格语境：Design Reform。 地域语境：Britain / Europe。

items.title: Fourdinois Sideboard – info is on earlier slide E.W. Godwin, Sideboard
items.description: Fourdinois Sideboard – info is on earlier slide E.W. Godwin, Sideboard, c. 1867. Made by William Watt. Ebonized mahogany, silver-plated fittings, embossed Japanese leather paper inserts.
items.studyDescription:
材质：Mahogany, Leather, Paper。时期：19th century (c. 1867)。历史背景：该侧柜与1851年伦敦大博览会语境相关，体现法国高端木作与国际博览会中“工业与工艺”展示机制的结合。
Material: Mahogany, Leather, Paper. Period: 19th century (c. 1867). Historical background: This sideboard is tied to the 1851 Great Exhibition in London and reflects how elite French cabinetmaking was positioned within international exhibition systems that staged industry alongside craft prestige.

metadata.author: Alexandre-Georges Fourdinois
metadata.historicalBackground:
该侧柜与1851年伦敦大博览会语境相关，体现法国高端木作与国际博览会中“工业与工艺”展示机制的结合。
This sideboard is tied to the 1851 Great Exhibition in London and reflects how elite French cabinetmaking was positioned within international exhibition systems that staged industry alongside craft prestige.

This sideboard is tied to the 1851 Great Exhibition in London and reflects how elite French cabinetmaking was positioned within international exhibition systems that staged industry alongside craft prestige.

items.title: The Peacock Room in the London home of Frederick R. Leyland originally designed by Thomas Jeckyll,and Redone by James Mc
items.description: The Peacock Room in the London home of Frederick R. Leyland originally designed by Thomas Jeckyll,and Redone by James McNeil Whistler
items.studyDescription:
材质：Not stated in source slide.。时期：Late 19th century。历史背景：孔雀屋由托马斯·杰基尔最初设计，后由惠斯勒在1876-1877年重绘为“蓝金和谐”，体现审美主义、赞助关系与东方主义展示政治的交织。
Material: Not stated in source slide.. Period: Late 19th century. Historical background: The Peacock Room began as Thomas Jeckyll's design and was transformed by Whistler in 1876-1877 into a 'harmony in blue and gold,' exemplifying Aesthetic movement ideals, patronage tensions, and orientalizing display culture.

metadata.author: James McNeill Whistler / Thomas Jeckyll
metadata.historicalBackground:

The Peacock Room began as Thomas Jeckyll's design and was transformed by Whistler in 1876-1877 into a 'harmony in blue and gold,' exemplifying Aesthetic movement ideals, patronage tensions, and orientalizing display culture.

items.studyDescription:
材质：Not stated in source slide.。时期：19th century (c. 1877)。历史背景：新艺术运动兴起于19世纪末，强调自然母题与“鞭线”曲线，并尝试统一纯艺术与应用艺术。 风格语境：Art Nouveau。 地域语境：France / Belgium。
Material: Not stated in source slide.. Period: 19th century (c. 1877). Historical background: Art Nouveau emerged in the late nineteenth century, drew heavily on natural forms, and used flowing 'whiplash' curves while seeking to unify fine and applied arts. Style context: Art Nouveau. Regional context: France / Belgium.

items.title: Arthur Haygate Mackmurdo Chair, mahogany with leather upholstery
items.description: Only the chair is required : Arthur Haygate Mackmurdo Chair, mahogany with leather upholstery, 1883 Edvard Munch, The Scream Lithograph 1895 Mackmurdo book cover Woodcut on handmade paper, 1883
items.studyDescription:
材质：Lithograph, Woodcut, Mahogany, Wood, Leather, Paper。时期：19th century (c. 1883)。历史背景：新艺术运动兴起于19世纪末，强调自然母题与“鞭线”曲线，并尝试统一纯艺术与应用艺术。 麦克默多家具常被视为连接工艺美术运动与早期新艺术的重要桥梁，尤其体现在线性节奏装饰与整体室内设计观上。 风格语境：Art Nouveau。 地域语境：Europe。
Material: Lithograph, Woodcut, Mahogany, Wood, Leather, Paper. Period: 19th century (c. 1883). Historical background: Art Nouveau emerged in the late nineteenth century, drew heavily on natural forms, and used flowing 'whiplash' curves while seeking to unify fine and applied arts. Mackmurdo's furniture is frequently cited as a bridge between Arts and Crafts and early Art Nouveau, especially for linear rhythmic ornament and integrated interior design thinking. Style context: Art Nouveau. Regional context: Europe.

Mackmurdo's furniture is frequently cited as a bridge between Arts and Crafts and early Art Nouveau, especially for linear rhythmic ornament and integrated interior design thinking. Style context: Art Nouveau. Regional context: Europe.

items.title: Henry van de Velde, Candelabra
items.description: Henry van de Velde, Candelabra , 1898-99 Electroplated bronze
items.studyDescription:
材质：Electroplated bronze, Bronze。时期：19th century (c. 1898-1899)。历史背景：新艺术运动兴起于19世纪末，强调自然母题与“鞭线”曲线，并尝试统一纯艺术与应用艺术。 克里斯托弗·德雷瑟的金属器设计体现工业时代的专业设计观，将植物研究与几何抽象转化为可制造的现代形态。 风格语境：Art Nouveau。 地域语境：Europe。
Material: Electroplated bronze, Bronze. Period: 19th century (c. 1898-1899). Historical background: Art Nouveau emerged in the late nineteenth century, drew heavily on natural forms, and used flowing 'whiplash' curves while seeking to unify fine and applied arts. Christopher Dresser's metalwork exemplifies industrial-age design expertise, translating botanical study and abstract geometry into manufacturable modern forms. Style context: Art Nouveau. Regional context: Europe.

items.description: George de Feure , Furniture, 1900. Gilded wood with silk covering; from the sitting room in L’Art Nouveau Bing Pavilion at Exposition Universelle , Paris 1900
items.studyDescription:
材质：Wood。时期：19th century (c. 1900)。历史背景：新艺术运动兴起于19世纪末，强调自然母题与“鞭线”曲线，并尝试统一纯艺术与应用艺术。 风格语境：Art Nouveau。 地域语境：France。
Material: Wood. Period: 19th century (c. 1900). Historical background: Art Nouveau emerged in the late nineteenth century, drew heavily on natural forms, and used flowing 'whiplash' curves while seeking to unify fine and applied arts. Style context: Art Nouveau. Regional context: France.

decks.title: Arts of Africa (Met Visit)
decks.default_background_en: Often linked to ritual authority, court culture, social memory, and later museum collection histories in African contexts.
decks.default_background_zh: 常与非洲语境中的仪式权力、宫廷文化、社会记忆，以及后期博物馆收藏史相关。

decks.title: Week 5: Art Nouveau
decks.default_background_en: Part of late-19th-century reform movements that rejected rigid historicism and rethought ornament, craft, and modern life.
decks.default_background_zh: 属于19世纪末设计改革思潮的一部分，反对僵化历史主义，并重新思考装饰、工艺与现代生活。

decks.title: Week 4: Industrial Revolution & Design Reform
decks.default_background_en: Connected to industrialization, the Great Exhibition, and Victorian debates about design quality, ornament, and mass manufacture.
decks.default_background_zh: 与工业化、大博览会，以及维多利亚时期关于设计质量、装饰与机械化生产的争论相关。
